turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh no, <UNSURE>it is</UNSURE>, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Can you hear me OK? Great. Hello there. Um, before I go any further, can I confirm you name and your age please?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes. So, my name is Robert.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Robert?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, I'm forty eight.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Great.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Excellent. And how can I help you this afternoon, sir?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Right, so, uh, I've been having, uh, diarrhoea, for like, <UNSURE>let's</UNSURE> say past three days, more or less.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, well I'm sorry to hear that. Uh can you tell me a bit more about your diarrhoea?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, so it's been a, very bad diarrhoea, so it keeps me like, I keep going back and forth, to, to the toilet very often.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Um</UNSURE>, yeah it started like three days ago.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: And uh, uh, so it started with vomiting, so I vomited a couple of times. Uh, but then, that went away, and, uh, yeah it's just diarrhoea now.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And you mentioned you've been um going to the toilet very often. How many times are you going a day?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, around, five to six times a day.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And uh uh can you tell me, I know it's not nice to talk about, but is it quite watery, your stools, loose?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, it's definitely, definitely watery, uh, loose stools, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: K. Any blood in your stools?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, not that I could see.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And uh uh uh with the diarrhea have you noticed any other symptoms, like tummy pain?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, not, not really, no. Uh, but I, I, I feel like, um, I can't, really drink too much, so I feel very dehydrated.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. When you say you can't drink too much, why is that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah because, really I, uh I, um, I'm like, <UNIN/> I feel like I don't drink enough, like I'm, I'm drink, I'm trying to drink, but then I just go to the loo, and I like, I, uh I, I, I do everything and I feel dehydrated again.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright. Um have you managed to eat anything, solids?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, <UNIN/> not much, not much. So just a little bit, but I don't feel, um, I don't really feel like, uh, I have appetite.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. You <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. OK. Um with your um, <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> the vomiting has now stopped. Is that right? You said

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yes</UNSURE>, yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright. Have you had any other symptoms, like fever or temperature?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, so, not, really I <UNIN/>, I feel a little bit warm, um, probably at, at the beginning I was feeling I had a bit of temperature, but now I feel, I feel kind of fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I feel very weak though.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> OK. Alright. Any headaches or muscle pains?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Not, not really, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright. And you mentioned three days ago. What were you doing when the symptoms started? Are you aware of any triggers?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>, not that I, I remember, what was I doing, I, I was at home I was working, on my computer and.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, just felt, like some nausea and I had to, to vomit, and then I had some diarrhoea, straight after that.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah. Did you have any takeaway food, or any dodgy restaurant food?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, not that I remember, no.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Have you been around anyone unwell, with diarrhea recently, last week or so?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Hmm</UNSURE>, not that I know, <UNSURE>not that I</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. OK. Um, right. So moving on, um are you otherwise fit and well?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh OK. And do you take any regular medications?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so I, I do suffer of asthma. So, I do have my inhalers, uh, that I you know, I <UNSURE>need</UNSURE>, I use infrequently, let's say only when I have, uh, a bit of <UNIN/>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Is that, is that <UNIN/> inhaler?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Sorry</UNSURE>?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Is that the blue inhaler? Blue inhaler. OK, alright. Any other medications that you take?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes it is, yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, nothing.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Do you have any allergies to medications?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, not that I know of.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. And any family history of any medical problems?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so, my father has, high uh, well used to have high blood pressure. He actually, so he actually died, of, bowel cancer, like ten years ago.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Sorry to hear that. Um, OK. And uh what about your mother?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh yes, so uh, probably is worth mentioning uh, she has diabetes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Diabetes. Do you know if that's type one or type two?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, it's type two.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK. Alright.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Fine. And um, just a little bit more about your life in general, sir. Um who, who's at home with you? Who lives at home with you?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Sorry?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Who lives at home with you, sir?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Ohh I, I live alone.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You live alone, OK. Are you currently working at the moment?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, well I haven't been able to work in the past few days, but yes <UNIN/>, like given, uh, my uh.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What's your employment? What do you do for work?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm a software engineer.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>. OK, alright.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Have you taken time off work recently?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yes, yes I have, uh. Uh, these last three days I've been feeling, really unwell, so I couldn't work.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright. And just the last couple of questions with, regarding your smoking and alcohol. Do you do either of those?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, not really, I drink infrequently, like socially let's say, and I don't smoke.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: OK, alright. Um fine. <UNIN/> uh Robert um

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> having listened to your story, I think you're probably suffering from what we call gastroenteritis, uh which essentially is just a, a tummy bug. It's an infection of your, your tummy. Um and normally lasts about three to five days, and gets better.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> the things you can do to really help yourself get better soon, um are you can drink plenty of fluids. Really try and flush the toxins out of your body.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh you can get things from the pharmacy, which is called Dioralyte, which can help replenish any <UNIN/> uh minerals and vitamins you may have lost. Uh, it's called <UNIN/> Dioralyte. Um it's, it's a, it's a type of fluid replacement drink.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: I'm sorry, what's the name of that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, you can take some Paracetamol if you're feeling feverish and weak.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I would probably advise you to continue taking time off work for next day or two, until you get better.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> normally you have to be diarrhea-free for about twenty four to forty eight hours, before you return back to work.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, let's see how the next few <UNIN/> days go. And if you're still not better next week, I want you to come back and see me.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And we can have another look at your symptoms, OK?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: That sounds good, that sounds good. Uh, thanks so much.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Thanks. <UNIN/> do you have any questions for me, or?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no I think that's fine. Uh, yeah I'll, I'll try to <UNIN/>, and drink <UNIN/>, drink plenty of fluid and I hope it <UNSURE>go away</UNSURE>. Uh, if it doesn't I'll uh, I'll call, I'll call back. Is that OK?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <INAUDIBLE_SPEECH/> I really hope you get better soon.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Thanks a lot. Thanks so much, for your time.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> <UNSURE>OK</UNSURE>. Bye bye.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: OK. Bye.
